title: Angular momentum - rank torques from L-t graph

content.question: A cylinder is rotating about its central axis. The graph shows the cylinder’s angular momentum <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>, where the positive direction is taken to be counterclockwise. Which of the following correctly compares the magnitudes <math alttext="tau" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>τ</mi></math> of the net torque exerted on the cylinder at the four times indicated by the labeled points on the graph?

choices.label: <math alttext="tau sub W is greater than tau sub X, which equals tau sub Z, which is greater than tau sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>W</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="tau sub X equals tau sub Y, which is greater than tau sub W, which equals tau sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>W</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="tau sub Y is greater than tau sub W, which equals tau sub Z, which is greater than tau sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>W</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="tau sub Z is greater than tau sub X, which is greater than tau sub Y, which is greater than tau sub W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>W</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="tau sub X equals tau sub Y, which is greater than tau sub W, which equals tau sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>W</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
